H0.text: Surface is where extrusive igneous rocks cool.

H1.text: Underground is where extrusive igneous rocks cool at.

H2.text: In volcanoes, extrusive igneous rocks cool.

H3.text: Extrusive igneous rocks cool in water.

A4.text: Extrusive igneous rock, also known as volcanic rock, is formed by the cooling of molten magma on the earth's surface.

A5.text: Solidification into rock occurs either below the surface as intrusive rocks or on the surface as extrusive rocks.
